name: Elaps corallinus
Relationship: Compare: KINO - from PTEROCARPUS (Hemoptysis and hemorrhage from intestines). EUCALYPTUS ROSTRATA (offensive dark discharge from right ear). CROTALUS; ALUMEN; CARBO; ARS.; LACH.

Eyes: Aversion to light; letters run together when reading
Bloated around the eyes in the morning
Large red fiery spots before eyes
Fever: Typhoid when ulcers have eaten into tissues, and black blood is discharged
Stomach: Sensation as if food turned like a cork-screw on swallowing; desire for sweetened buttermilk
Mind: Depressed; imagines he hears someone talking; dreads to be left alone
Can speak, but cannot understand speech
Head: Violent headache, extending from forehead TO OCCIPUT; first one eye, then the other
Pain in ears
Vertigo with tendency to fall forward
Weight and pain in forehead
Fullness in head
Chest: Hemorrhage from lungs black as ink and watery; stitches in APEX OF RIGHT LUNG
Peeling off of skin from palms and fingers
COUGH, with terrible pain through lungs
Worse right and expectoration of black blood
Sensation of a sponge in oesophagus
Nose: CHRONIC NASAL CATARRH, WITH FETID ODOR AND GREENISH CRUSTS
Mucous membrane wrinkled; nostrils plugged up with dry mucus
Pains from nose to ears on swallowing
Female: Discharge of black blood between menses
Skin: Glands and skin of axillae affected; itching with tetter
Throat: Thick, very offensive, dry, greenish-yellow crusts upon the posterior pharyngeal wall and extremely foul breath
Spasmodic contraction of ESOPHAGUS; passage of fluids arrested
Ears: Cerumen BLACK and hard, with difficult hearing, or serous GREENISH discharge, offensive; buzzing, and illusion of hearing
Sudden attack of nightly deafness, with roaring and crackling in ears, cracking in ears on swallowing

details: Similar to snake-poisons generally. Has very marked BLACK DISCHARGES. COLD THINGS DISAGREE. Desire for sweetened buttermilk. Nausea and vomiting. Prostrating diarrhoea of consumption. Acidity of stomach, with faint feeling. Sudden pain in stomach. Spasm of oesophagus; pharynx constricted; food and liquids suddenly arrested, and then fall heavily into stomach. Spasms followed by paresis. COLD FEELING IN STOMACH. Fruits and ice-water lie very cold. RIGHT-SIDED PARALYSIS. Must have oscillatory motion. Rheumatic constitutions. Ear, nose and throat symptoms important.Preferable in otorrhoea and affections of right lung
